channel.title: BBC News - Europe

item.title: Greece wildfires: Hundreds more evacuated as uncontrolled fires rage
item.description: Ferries carry tourists and locals to safety from Greece's second-largest island, Evia.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Russians win most medals since 2004 despite competing as ROC because of ban
item.description: Russian athletes head home with more medals than they have for 17 years - and they were not even officially competing for their country.

item.title: Lionel Messi: Paris St-Germain move 'a possibility' after Barcelona exit
item.description: A tearful Lionel Messi says joining Paris St-Germain from Barcelona is "a possibility, but nothing is agreed".

item.title: Covid-19: Quarantine-free travel from France resumes as UK rules change
item.description: Some travel firms report a "surge" of bookings but others say it is "too late to save the summer".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team USA beat France 87-82 to claim fourth straight gold medal
item.description: USA beat France to win their fourth basketball gold medal in a row.

item.title: Spain defeated by Brazil for men's football gold
item.description: Brazil defend their Olympic men's football title following a dramatic extra-time victory over Spain.

item.title: Bat killed by cat after record 1,200-mile journey
item.description: A record-breaking bat - the size of a human thumb - is discovered in Russia after flying from London.

item.title: Belarus crackdown fails to crush opposition spirit
item.description: Beaten up, jailed, forced into exile - protesters are still battling against President Lukashenko.

item.title: Eurovision, Euro 2020 and Tokyo 2020 Olympics - Italy's golden summer
item.description: "This is Italy's moment of glory" - after Eurovision & Euro 2020 victories, an Italian Wimbledon finalist, now comes Olympics history in Tokyo.

item.title: Will Turkey's bees return after the wildfires?
item.description: Residents of Marmaris, Turkey, are mourning their bees and honey, lost to fires.

item.title: What is Fox News host Carlson doing in Hungary?
item.description: The controversial news host is the latest high-profile ally of Hungary's embattled prime minister.

item.title: Brexit rules burden bands touring in EU
item.description: One band explain what it's been like trying to tour in France in the age of Covid and Brexit.

item.title: What are the big aims for the UN climate summit?
item.description: The annual climate change summit is being held in Glasgow - who's going and what's at stake?

item.title: Greece fires: Hundreds rescued by coastguard
item.description: The coastguard moved 650 people from Limni, in the north of the island of Evia.

item.title: 'They call me the Irish hulk of basketball'
item.description: Aidan Igiehon is part of a group of elite Irish athletes playing college basketball in America.

item.title: Will Turkey's bees return after the wildfires?
item.description: Residents of Marmaris, Turkey, are mourning their bees and honey, lost to fires.

item.title: Tankus the Henge: Touring in France post-Brexit 'a puzzle'
item.description: Band Tankus the Henge negotiates touring in France, their first trip there since Brexit rules were imposed.

item.title: Athlete Krystina Timanovskaya: 'It's dangerous for me in Belarus'
item.description: Athlete Krystina Timanovskaya tells the BBC that she can't return to her home country over safety fears.
